ygData.subject: RE: More clues from Lindell, third book confirmed, and more...
ygData.msgSnippet: Here here! Bravo! Couldn t have said it better myself. I too am going to make an expedition there, and, as soon as I can get to level 20 (because of the sharks
ygData.messageBody:
Here here! Bravo! Couldn't have said it better myself. I too am going to
make an expedition there, and, as soon as I can get to level 20 (because of
the sharks and other powerful things) I'm going to borrow a fishbone earring
from a guild member and search the ocean floor. The earring gives unlimited
breath, so I won't need to come up for air.

>A little bird told me.
>If anyone would think about it...from every lie to every truth I have ever
>heard, the one thing that is constant is that we should "search beneath the
>waves". Think about the story behind things. If I have learned anything
>from
>playing EverQuest for all of these months, I have learned that Verant and
>the programmers love a good story. They love to flesh things out, why else
>would so many of these quests be long and drawn out. Think of the story
>behind the cave ad the necro there, he is supposed to be banished there by
>the gods in a huge epic tale, not because of some measly tinkering book. As
>well with the spelunker fer one thing he is NOT beneath the waves. I dont
>know what the story behind him is but come on if it were that easy do you
>not think someone has tried that by now? NO our answer does lie in the
>realms of the submerged, no probably not kedge keep as it is not itemized.
>Has anyone ever heard someone say anything about the battle they ad against
>sea serpents? Probably not. Why? because no one as explored the depths. No
>one has spent an entire month drudging the ocean floors. Maybe one or two
>people were masicistic enough or maybe just bored enough to one day decide
>to go hunt the oceans for things maybe they fell off a boat and
>accidentally
>caught a glimpse of something that changed everything. Maybe its in lake
>rathe, mayvbe its in the ocean of tears, maybe its in erud's crossing, I
>dont know but if anywere these are the three likely places.
>I have heard multiple rumors of a secret cave on erollisi island wher you
>push a button and hear some grinding. I have yet to find this button but it
>has been said enough to me to get some of my attention. Im planning an
>expedidtion on the bertoxxulous server for this next weekend to go to the
>ocean of tears and to comb the ocean floor if i have to but if its there to
>find i will find it. Subsequest trips will be to erud's crossing and lake
>rathe but for now my hopes and my ideas are drawing me to the ocean of
>tears. Start your own expeditions. With enough people looking for it it
>will
>be found and the secrets of tinkering will belong to us all!
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Ralph Scott [mailto:rscott@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 1999 3:50 PM
>To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] More clues from Lindell, third book
>confirmed, and more...
>
>
>From: Ralph Scott <rscott@...>
>
>Michael Ott wrote:
> >
> > From: Michael Ott <mott@...>
> >
> > the necro is not the way to go neiter is the spelunker...
> >
>
>And you know this how??
>
>---ralph
>
